340B Orphan Drug Discounts Dialed Back

Law360, New York (October 14, 2015, 9:28 PM ET) -- The Affordable Care Act fully exempts orphan drugs from mandatory discounts under the 340B program for certain health care providers, a D.C. federal judge said Wednesday in an important victory for trade group Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America.



The decision from U.S. District Judge Rudolph Contreras vacated a rule issued last year by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. The rule interpreted the ACA as requiring discounts when orphan drugs are used for diseases that aren’t rare, but PhRMA filed suit, arguing that...
